typeinfo.hpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #ifndef _BOOST_REFLECT_TYPEINFO_HPP
00002 #define _BOOST_REFLECT_TYPEINFO_HPP
00003 namespace boost { namespace reflect {
00004 
00005 /**
00006  *  @brief provides compile time access to name of a type.
00007  */
00008 template<typename T>
00009 struct get_typeinfo { 
00010   enum is_defined_enum{ is_defined = 0 };
00011   static const char* name() { return typeid(T).name(); }
00012 };
00013 
00014 /**
00015  *  @brief Removes all decorations and returns the typename.
00016  */
00017 template<typename T>
00018 inline const char* get_typename()  {
00019   return get_typeinfo<typename boost::remove_const<
00020                       typename boost::remove_reference<
00021                       typename boost::remove_pointer<T>::type>::type>::type>::name();
00022 }
00023 #ifndef DOXYGEN
00024 template<typename TP, template<typename> class C> 
00025 struct get_typeinfo< C<TP> > { 
00026   // used to specify template get_typeinfo
00027 
00028   enum is_defined_enum{ is_defined = get_typeinfo<TP>::is_defined }; 
00029   static const char* name() 
00030   {  
00031     static std::string n = std::string( get_typename<C<void_t> >() ) + 
00032                                "<" + std::string(get_typename<TP>()) +  ">"; 
00033     return n.c_str(); 
00034   } 
00035 }; 
00036 
00037 template<typename TP, typename TP2, template<typename, typename> class C> 
00038 struct get_typeinfo< C<TP,TP2> > { 
00039   enum is_defined_enum{ is_defined = get_typeinfo<TP>::is_defined && get_typeinfo<TP2>::is_defined }; 
00040   static const char* name() 
00041   {  
00042     static std::string n = std::string( get_typename< C<void_t,void_t> >() ) + 
00043                                 "<" + std::string(get_typename<TP>()) +  "," + 
00044                                       std::string( get_typename<TP>() ) + ">"; 
00045     return n.c_str(); 
00046   } 
00047 };
00048 #endif
00049 
00050 /**
00051  *  @brief Allows the typename to be accessed via get_typename<T>() in a 
00052  *  cross-platform, demangled way that std::typeinfo cannot do.
00053  */
00054 #define BOOST_REFLECT_TYPEINFO( NAME ) \
00055 namespace boost { namespace reflect { \
00056 template<> \
00057 struct get_typeinfo<NAME> { \
00058     enum is_defined_enum{ is_defined = 1 }; \
00059     static const char* name() { return BOOST_PP_STRINGIZE(NAME); } \
00060 }; } }
00061 
00062 
00063 /**
00064  *  @brief Same as BOOST_REFLECT_TYPEINFO except works for templates with 1 paramater.
00065  */
00066 #define BOOST_REFLECT_TEMPLATE_TYPEINFO( NAME ) \
00067 namespace boost { namespace reflect {\
00068 template<>\
00069 struct get_typeinfo<NAME<void_t> > { \
00070     enum is_defined_enum{ is_defined = 1 }; \
00071     static const char* name() { return BOOST_PP_STRINGIZE(NAME); } \
00072 }; } }
00073 
00074 /**
00075  *  @brief Same as BOOST_REFLECT_TYPEINFO except works for templates with 2 paramaters.
00076  */
00077 #define BOOST_REFLECT_TEMPLATE2_TYPEINFO( NAME ) \
00078 namespace boost { namespace reflect {\
00079 template<>\
00080 struct get_typeinfo<NAME<void_t,void_t> > { \
00081     enum is_defined_enum{ is_defined = 1 }; \
00082     static const char* name() { return BOOST_PP_STRINGIZE(NAME); } \
00083 }; } }
00084 
00085 } } // boost::reflect
